metadata.dc:author: Estebanez Zarranz, M J
Santos Largo, J
Amón Sesmero, J
Barrera Rebollo, A
Pelaz Salomón, A
Martínez-Sagarra Oceja, J M
metadata.dc:description: We present in this paper a series of cases from our Service of primary abscesses in psoas. We consider the appearance of immunosuppressed patients as a relevant factor of its etiopathogenicity. We believe that a C.A.T. is the best diagnostic method. All three patients that underwent open surgery have had complications. The patients treated with percutaneous puncture has shown a favourable evolution.
metadata.dc:title: Abscesos primarios de psoas.
[Primary abscess of the psoas].
